poem:
Bulgaria's Bargain

In the cold steel of commerce,  
old alliances rust;  
refineries speak in tongues  
of sanctioned whispers.  
The earth rumbles as borders shift,  
Poland, a new breath in its chest—  
gas conduit dreams.  
In the shadow of power,  
nations become pawns,  
history's quiet symphony  
repeating its mournful chorus.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
